intro: Pterichis elliptica var. ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian elliptic pterichis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, often with a slight pinkish hue. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests at higher elevations. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
